content.description: Starts standing in the middle of the wall. Traverses left on good holds until under the small roof. Climb out of roof using jugs and crimps to the obvious shelf feature. Climb straight up to the lip. The giant flake-like feature to the left is off.
content.location: Starts in the middle of wall and moves left and up.

content.description: Stand or sit to the left of the large roof feature. Follow up good holds and then reach for the side pull with your left hand. Then fire your right hand up to the jug and move to the lip of the boulder for an easy mantel. It's a little bit contrived, but it climbs well.
content.location: The Shaft starts standing(or sitting)to the left of large roof feature.

content.description: Start standing in middle of wall, just to the right of the large block stuck in the ground. Grab on ok holds and dyno to the shelf feature. Move up wall using a blocky triangle hold and several crimps to gain the lip of the wall. Easy mantel
content.location: Middle of the wall, to the right of the block stuck in the ground.

content.description: Start on rounded holds just left of the roof, move up to crack seam and traverse right on that as it turns into a shelf under the roof, move right a few moves along that shelf until you can reach back to a good pinch at the lip of the roof. Match it up and bring your feet up to the shelf you were just traversing along, from here make a big reach straight up to the lip of the boulder, traverse a few moves to the left and you can then either mantle or keep traversing left into easier terrain to topoout.
content.protection: 3-4 pads & spotters would be recommended, a fall on or after the crux could be dangerous.
content.location: The right side of the skyline area, starting left of and moving through the roof feature on the right end of that wall.

content.description: Right below the last ride left standing from the old Rocky Point Amusement Park. The Sky Line.
